articles.description: Cole Palmer scores two goals in injury time to earn Chelsea a win against Manchester United despite having previously given up a two-goal lead.
articles.title: Palmer scores twice in injury time as Chelsea beat Man Utd

articles.description: Logan Sargeant crashes heavily in first practice at the Japanese Grand Prix to heap further problems on his Williams team.
articles.title: Japanese Grand Prix: Max Verstappen tops first practice as Sargeant crashes

articles.description: Inaki and Nico Williams' parents travelled to Bilbao from Ghana hoping the city would change their sons' lives. Their sons, in turn, have changed the city.
articles.title: Two brothers, one club and a 40-year wait

articles.description: Teenager Luke Littler makes it successive Premier League Darts nightly wins with a 6-3 victory over Gerwyn Price in Manchester.
articles.title: Luke Littler beats Gerwyn Price to win successive Premier League Darts nights

articles.description: Alexis Jandard laughs off the incident on social media, posting, “My back is fine, but my ego…”.
articles.title: Moment diver slips during Olympic pool inauguration

articles.description: Liverpool battle to a win over Sheffield United to move back to the top of the Premier League and maintain control of the title race.
articles.title: Liverpool battle past Blades to return to top

articles.description: Reigning Tour de France champion Jonas Vingegaard suffers a broken collarbone and several broken ribs in a crash at the Itzulia Basque Country stage race.
articles.title: Itzulia Basque Country: Jonas Vingegaard suffers broken collarbone and ribs in crash

articles.description: With the new County Championship season starting on Friday, can anyone prevent Surrey winning a third straight title?
articles.title: Can Surrey be beaten as County Championship returns?

articles.description: Rafael Nadal pulls out of Monte Carlo Masters, saying his body "simply won't allow" him to play.
articles.title: Rafael Nadal: Spaniard pulls out of Monte Carlo Masters saying body not up to it

articles.description: Frida Maanum has undergone tests which found "no obvious cardiac causes" for her collapse in the Continental Cup final, say her club Arsenal.
articles.title: 'No obvious cardiac causes' for Maanum collapse
